title: Prehistorik 2, anyone?
content:
This used to be my favourite platform game, but then came Commander Keen [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Have you played it?

I even speedrunned it on Expert difficulty , about 8 minutes at one level at a time and without cutscenes. Awesome game with lots of shortcuts.

title: Re: Prehistorik 2, anyone?
content:
I played it for a while.
I also played the original after that, but noticed the sequel was better overall; which is good for a sequel obviously. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
I don't think I got very far, but I definately had fun with it.Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Prehistorik 2, anyone?
content:
I forgot how amusing this game was. Discovered it about a decade ago, but haven't played it for years so it' been lying dormant in my abandonware collection.

I could never get very far either. Must load it up on the DOS Beast sometime and see how I go. How does one change the difficulty level? All I get for the menu are two options--to start the game or enter a password.

title: Re: Prehistorik 2, anyone?
content:
I love Prehistorik, but not really played the second one.. Would love to see the speedrun video!3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Prehistorik 2, anyone?
content:
I friend of mine made a [url=http://pre2.mine.nu/]Prehistorik 2 fan page[/url] with maps of all the levels.

[quote]Quote:[hr]How does one change the difficulty level? All I get for the menu are two options--to start the game or enter a password.[hr][/quote]

Choose option 1 "Start Level 1" and you'll see the word beginner on your screen. Then press up or down to change this to expert.Groeten van Frenkel
Visit [url=http://www.sfprod.cjb.net]The Official S&F Prod. Homepage[/url]

title: Re: Prehistorik 2, anyone?
content:
WOW!
Great maps! I found a number of secrets I didn't know before. That really helped a lot, thanks.

I saw his Titus the Fox (one of my other favourite games) fansite too, that had great maps and tools. Awesome.

title: Re: Prehistorik 2, anyone?
content:
Oooh, Titus has a trainer now! Me must get!

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Prehistorik 2, anyone?
content:
Gaaarg! Why has nobody told me about this site before! Awesome maps, cheers! He probably has made somekind of program to read that stuff.. Hopefully there'll be a level editor one day.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Prehistorik 2, anyone?
content:
I CAN'T wait to be able to make my own prehistorik 2 maps [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oops.gif[/img]

And TTF has a map editor already!

title: Re: Prehistorik 2, anyone?
content:
My friend would like to put your Prehistorik 2 speedrun on his website if it wasn't so big.Groeten van Frenkel
Visit [url=http://www.sfprod.cjb.net]The Official S&F Prod. Homepage[/url]

title: Re: Prehistorik 2, anyone?
content: Could you give me his messenger address if he has any? Or at least email or IRC location? Some if the videos in my old speedruns aren't so great now that I've seen those maps.

title: Re: Prehistorik 2, anyone?
content:
I've completed the first level and got all the items, including all the secret ones. This means that at the end of the level it says that I've completed it for 100%.

Here's a video at [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GW-wRuiev4s]YouTube[/url].Groeten van Frenkel
Visit [url=http://www.sfprod.cjb.net]The Official S&F Prod. Homepage[/url]

title: Re: Prehistorik 2, anyone?
content:
I thought I knew a few secrets, but after seeing that video...
WOW, are those items random!

Randomly placed I mean... did the developers seriously expect people to achieve 100%; I sure hope not.
Frenkel, if you found those all out yourself; congratulations!
You must be a very patient (bored?) man! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Uh... wow
content: Ah, another huge video; That's some impressive gameplay I must admit, far, far better than I would fare.

title: Re: Uh... wow
content:
I found every secret myself, except for the big ice cream at the end in the "well done!" part. I used a level viewer program that I wrote to find that one. I won't release that program.

But I'll release my [url=http://www.student.tue.nl/p/f.a.m.smeijers/sfp/]Prehistorik 2 Sprite dumper[/url] that I announced four years ago in a [url=http://dosclassics.com/ckn/newsletter/issues/2003-03-31.txt]Commander Keen Newsletter[/url] (remember those? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] ).Groeten van Frenkel
Visit [url=http://www.sfprod.cjb.net]The Official S&F Prod. Homepage[/url]
